Problem:
Consider a system governed by the Laplace Transform \\( \\mathcal{L}\{f(t)\} = F(s) \\). We examine the effects of the convolution operation using a kernel \\( k(t) \\) with its transform \\( K(s) \\), on the system function \\( f(t) \\).

If an intervention is applied at time t = t_1 using another convolution with a different kernel \\( k_1(t) \\), will the system's output at time t = T solely depend on the original function \\( f(t) \\) and not on the type of interventions applied?
Explanation: The intervention using another kernel \\( k_1(t) \\) at t_1 will further modify the system by convolving with \\( k_1(t) \\), influencing and potentially altering the trajectory and final output of the system at t = T. Thus, the output depends on both the initial and intervened conditions.
